cookieBanner.title: Cookies on GOV.UK One Login
cookieBanner.heading: Cookies on GOV.UK One Login
cookieBanner.paragraph1: We use some essential cookies to make this service work.
cookieBanner.paragraph2: We’d like to set additional cookies so we can remember your settings, understand how people use the service and make improvements.

cookieBannerReject.paragraph1: You’ve rejected additional cookies. You can

content.paragraph1: We cannot find the page you’re looking for.
content.paragraph2: If you typed the web address, check it’s correct.
content.paragraph3: If you pasted the web address, check you copied the entire address.
content.paragraph4: You can also go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

content.paragraph1: Go back to the service you were trying to use and start again. You can look for the service using your search engine or find it from the GOV.UK homepage.

content.paragraph2: Continue proving your identity online.

pyiNoMatch.title: Sorry, we cannot confirm your identity
pyiNoMatch.header: Sorry, we cannot confirm your identity

content.paragraph1: We could not find a match when we checked your details with another organisation.
content.paragraph1BankAccount: We could not find a match when we checked your details with your bank or building society.
content.paragraph1Nino: We could not find a match for your National Insurance number when we checked your details with HMRC.
content.paragraph2: To keep your information safe, we cannot tell you which of your details we were unable to match.
content.paragraph3: Continue to the service you were trying to use to find out if there are other ways to prove your identity

content.paragraph4: You can also prove your identity at a Post Office. This option takes longer. You’ll usually get an outcome within a day of going to the Post Office.

pyiEscapeM2b.title: Find another way to prove your identity
pyiEscapeM2b.header: Find another way to prove your identity

content.subHeading: If you do not have photo ID
content.paragraph1: You can try proving your identity with the service you need to use. They may take other types of ID.
content.paragraph2: You can use photo ID to prove your identity using the GOV.UK ID Check app or at a Post Office.

details.label: Types of photo ID you can use
details.text:
You can use a:

  • UK photocard driving licence
  • European Union (EU) photocard driving licence
  • UK passport
  • non-UK passport
  • National identity card from a European Economic Area (EEA) country
  • UK biometric residence permit (BRP)
  • UK biometric residence card (BRC)
  • UK Frontier Worker permit

content.subHeading3: What would you like to do?

formRadioButtons.radioButton1Text: Go to the service you need to use and find out if they take other types of ID

pyiTimeoutRecoverable.title: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login
pyiTimeoutRecoverable.header: You have been signed out of your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: This could be because:
content.bullet1: you signed in more than an hour ago
content.bullet2: you signed out while you were using another service
content.bullet3: more than one browser (for example Chrome, Safari) was used
content.bullet4: you started your application from a link in an app (such as Facebook or Instagram)
content.paragraph2: If you started your journey from a link in another app or browser:
content.list1: Go back to the app or browser you started your journey from.
content.list2: Select the 'Link GOV.UK ID Check' button to continue your application.
content.paragraph3: If you signed in more than an hour ago, or you signed out while you were using another service, continue to the service you were trying to use and start again.

pagePreExperianKbvTransition.title: Answer security questions

content.paragraph1: We’ll ask you some security questions that only you should know the answers to. This will help us stop anyone else who might have your details from pretending to be you.
content.paragraph2: The questions will be about things like your mobile phone contract, bank account, and any credit cards, loans or mortgages you have.
content.paragraph3: We will not keep your answers.

pagePreExperianKbvTransition.warningTextContent: Try to answer these questions as accurately as you can. You will not be able to change your answers if you make a mistake.
pagePreExperianKbvTransition.summaryText: How we know what questions to ask you
pagePreExperianKbvTransition.summaryHtml:
We’ll work with Experian (opens in a new tab) to make sure we ask you questions that only you can answer. This is because companies like Experian have access to lots of information that we can check your answers against.

Read our privacy notice (opens in a new tab) if you’d like to know more about how your details will be used to prove your identity.

pageF2fHandoff.title: Go to the Post Office within 10 days to finish proving your identity
pageF2fHandoff.panelText: Go to the Post Office within 10 days to finish proving your identity

content.paragraph1: You’ve been sent a confirmation email with a link to download your Post Office customer letter.
content.paragraph2: To finish proving your identity, you need to go to your chosen Post Office within the next 10 days.
content.subHeading1: What you need to take to the Post Office
content.paragraph3: When you go to the Post Office, make sure to take your:
content.bullet2: Post Office customer letter (you can download your letter from your confirmation email)
content.paragraph4: You’ll need to show your Post Office customer letter on your phone or tablet, or take a printed copy with you.
content.paragraph5: A member of Post Office staff will scan your photo ID and take a photo of you.
content.paragraph6: You’ll find details of your chosen Post Office in your customer letter. But you can
content.paragraph6LinkText: go to any Post Office that offers in-branch verification (opens in new tab)
content.insetText: If you do not go to the Post Office within the next 10 days, you’ll need to start proving your identity again.
content.subHeading3: After you’ve been to the Post Office
content.paragraph7: You’ll get an email about the result of your identity check – usually within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.bullet3: need help to finish proving your identity with the Post Office
content.bullet4: would prefer not to go to the Post Office and want to prove your identity another way

pageDcmawSuccess.title: We’ve successfully matched you to the photo on your ID
pageDcmawSuccess.header: We’ve successfully matched you to the photo on your ID

content.paragraph1: You’ll need to enter your current home address (and previous address, if you’ve recently moved) when you continue.

pyiNewDetails.title: Prove your identity again with new details
pyiNewDetails.header: Prove your identity again with new details

content.paragraph1: To update your details, you need to:
content.list2: prove your identity again with new details
content.paragraph2: You'll need:
content.list3: photo ID with the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use
content.list4: to tell us where you've lived for the last 3 months
content.paragraph3: Find out what photo ID you can use to prove your identity (opens in new tab).
content.warningTextContent: You will not be able to continue to the service you need to use if we cannot confirm your identity again using your new details.
content.subHeading1: If you need to use the service now
content.paragraph4: Your proof of identity is still valid even if your details are out of date.
content.paragraph5: You can use your current details to access the service you need to use.
content.subHeading2: What would you like to do?

pyiDetailsDeleted.title: You have deleted the details in your GOV.UK One Login
pyiDetailsDeleted.header: You have deleted the details in your GOV.UK One Login

content.paragraph1: You've been sent a confirmation email.
content.paragraph2F2f: Your Post Office customer letter is no longer valid and you should not try to use it to prove your identity.
content.paragraph2: You can now prove your identity again using your new details.
content.paragraph3F2f: You can now try to prove your identity another way.
content.paragraph3: You'll need:
content.list1: photo ID with the name you want GOV.UK One Login to use
content.list2: to tell us where you've lived for the last 3 months
content.paragraph4F2f: Find out about the different ways to prove your identity with GOV.UK One Login (opens in new tab).
content.paragraph4: Find out what photo ID you can use to prove your identity (opens in new tab).
content.submitButtonText: Continue to prove your identity again

content.paragraph1: If you no longer want to prove your identity at a Post Office, you can delete your details and try to prove your identity another way.
content.paragraph2: Find out about the different ways to prove your identity with GOV.UK One Login (opens in new tab).
content.insetText: After you’ve deleted your details, your Post Office customer letter will no longer be valid and you should not try to use it to prove your identity.
content.paragraph3: We will automatically delete your details if you do not go to the Post Office within 10 days of getting your confirmation email.
content.paragraph4LinkText: I want to prove my identity at a Post Office

content.paragraph1: You can continue proving your identity online if you:
content.bullet1: have a UK driving licence (full or provisional) or a UK passport
content.paragraph2: We use security questions to stop anyone who might have your details from pretending to be you.

pageIpvReuse.title: You have already proved your identity
pageIpvReuse.header: You have already proved your identity

content.paragraph1: You have already proved your identity with GOV.UK One Login. You would have done this online or in person at the Post Office.
content.paragraph2: You can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.paragraph3: You submitted the following details when you proved your identity. You might want to check your details are still correct if you’ve not signed in to GOV.UK One Login in a while.
content.paragraph4: Some of these details might be used to automatically fill in the forms within the service you need to use.

updateUserDetailsInformation.updateDetailsHtml: You can contact the GOV.UK One Login team (opens in new tab) to update your details.

pageIpvPending.title: You have not finished proving your identity
pageIpvPending.header: You have not finished proving your identity

content.paragraph1: You need to go to a Post Office that offers in-branch verification to finish proving your identity.
content.paragraph2: You should have received a confirmation email explaining what to take with you and what will happen at the Post Office. Check the letter in your confirmation email.
content.subHeading: If you’ve already been to the Post Office
content.paragraph3: Your identity check is still being processed.
content.paragraph4: You’ll get an email when there’s a result for your identity check - usually within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.list1: need help to finish proving your identity with the Post Office
content.list2: would prefer not to go to the Post Office and want to prove your identity another way

pageIpvSuccess.title: Continue to the service you want to use
pageIpvSuccess.header: Continue to the service you want to use

content.paragraph1: You’ve successfully proved your identity. You can now continue to the service you want to use.
content.paragraph1SixMonthFraudCheck: We've checked your details, you can now continue to the service you need to use.
content.paragraph2: Some of the information you shared when you proved your identity might be used to automatically fill in forms within the service.

pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.title: Tell us if you have one of the following types of photo ID
pageIpvIdentityDocumentStart.header: Tell us if you have one of the following types of photo ID

content.paragraph: This will help us find the best way for you to prove your identity.
content.paragraph1: You can use a full or provisional UK driving licence if it:
content.list1: is a plastic photocard, not a paper licence
content.paragraph3: You can use any UK passport if it has not expired.
content.subHeading3: Non-UK passport with a biometric chip
content.paragraph4: You can use a non-UK passport if it:
content.paragraph5: To check if your passport has a biometric chip, look for the rectangular biometric chip symbol on the front cover.
content.imgAltText: The front cover of a passport with the biometric chip symbol. The symbol is rectangular with a circle in the middle.
content.paragraph6: You can use a UK biometric resident permit (BRP) that has not expired. You might have a BRP if you have a visa for longer than 6 months or indefinite leave to remain.
content.paragraph7: This is also called a UK residence card. You can use a BRC that has not expired. You might have a BRC if you’re in the UK as a family member of a citizen from a European Economic Area (EEA) country.
content.paragraph8: You can use an FWP that has not expired. You might have an FWP if you work in the UK but live in another country.
content.subHeading7: Do you have any of these types of photo ID?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have any of these types of photo ID
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select yes if you have any of these types of photo ID

pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.title: Prove your identity at a Post Office with one of the following types of photo ID
pageIpvIdentityPostofficeStart.header: Prove your identity at a Post Office with one of the following types of photo ID

content.paragraph1: Based on what you told us, you cannot prove your identity online.
content.paragraph2: If you have any of the following types of photo ID, you can prove your identity at a Post Office instead.
content.insetText: This option is not available in Welsh yet
content.paragraph3: You can use an EU driving licence if:
content.list1: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten licence
content.list3: the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.paragraph4: You can use a non-UK passport as long as it has not expired.
content.subHeading3: National identity card from a European Economic Area country
content.paragraph5: You can use a national identity card from a European Economic Area (EEA) country if:
content.list4: it is a plastic photocard, not a paper or handwritten card
content.list6: the address on it is the same as your current address (if it has an address)
content.paragraph6: The EEA includes EU countries, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein.
content.subHeading4: Do you have any of these types of photo ID?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select what you would like to do
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select what you would like to do

pageIpvBankAccountStart.title: Prove your identity with bank or building society details and security questions
pageIpvBankAccountStart.header: Prove your identity with bank or building society details and security questions

content.paragraph1: You can use any current account with a UK bank or building society to prove your identity. Your name must be on the account.
content.paragraph2: We'll ask you for your:
content.list5: current address (you might also need your previous address if you've recently moved)
content.paragraph3: We'll then ask you some security questions. This helps us check if the details you've given are being used by you.
content.subHeading3: Do you have a UK bank or building society current account in your name?

formRadioButtons.otherWayButtonText: No - prove my identity another way

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have a UK bank or building society account in your name
formErrorMessage.errorRadioMessage: Select yes if you have a UK bank or building society account in your name

pyiPostOffice.title: Prove your identity at a Post Office - GOV.UK One Login
pyiPostOffice.header: Prove your identity at a Post Office

content.paragraph1: You can prove your identity at a Post Office instead.
content.paragraph2: You’ll be asked to:
content.list1: enter details from your photo ID on GOV.UK
content.list2: go to a Post Office where they’ll scan your ID and take a photo of you
content.paragraph3: You’ll usually get a result within a day of going to the Post Office.
content.subHeading: Types of photo ID you can use at a Post Office
content.paragraph4: You’ll need one of the following:
content.list3: a UK photocard driving licence (full or provisional)
content.list7: a European Union (EU) photocard driving licence
content.list8: a national identity card from a European Economic Area (EEA) country
content.insetText: You cannot prove your identity at a Post Office with a Frontier Worker permit (FWP) or a UK biometric residence card (BRC), also called a UK residence card.
content.subHeading2: Do you have photo ID you can use at a Post Office?

formErrorMessage.errorSummaryDescriptionText: Select yes if you have photo ID you can use at a Post Office
